node.title: Trampers urged to prepare, have plan B before heading out this Easter
node.description: Trampers and walkers are urged to keep an eye on the forecast, prepare for changing conditions and have a plan B this Easter.

node.title: Ex-NYC mayor on possible Cuomo comeback: "He should get the hell off the stage"
node.description: Cuomo resigned in August 2021 amid sexual harassment allegations and as the state legislature pursued an impeachment inquiry.

node.title: 85% of silage film imported to New Zealand now being recycled
node.description: About 85 percent of the silage film being imported into New Zealand is now being recycled, after silage wrap distributor Webbline joined a large-scale recycling scheme.

node.title: Patrick Lyoya's father says his son was "killed like an animal"
node.description: Grand Rapids police say they will not identify the officer unless he's named as a suspect.

node.title: Woman dies after getting entangled upside down on U.S.-Mexico border wall
node.description: The local sheriff's office said the woman was a 32-year-old who was attempting to cross the wall Monday night near Douglas, Arizona.

node.title: Elon Musk makes offer to buy Twitter
node.description: Tesla boss Elon Musk has offered to buy Twitter, saying he is the right person to "unlock" the social media platform's "extraordinary potential".

node.title: One dead in car crash while fleeing police
node.description: A person has died in Auckland overnight after a car crashed while trying to flee from police.

node.title: One company's solution for more affordable housing: 3D-printed homes
node.description: "People cannot afford a home. That is the American dream — or rather was the American dream. We need to get back to that."

node.title: Ohio man who said Trump "directed" him to join Jan. 6 riot is convicted
node.description: Dustin Thompson, who unsuccessfully tried to call former President Trump as a  witness in his jury trial, was led out of the courtroom in handcuffs.

node.title: Gun map: Ownership by state

node.title: How to tell the difference between seasonal allergies and COVID-19
node.description: As allergy season collides with another rise in COVID-19 cases, deciphering between symptoms can be tricky.

node.title: 'A national shame': Plea for long-term support for troops on mission to aid Ukraine
node.description: The RSA is seeking assurances military personnel being sent to Europe to assist the allied effort for Ukraine, will get the appropriate support in the future.

node.title: FDA authorizes breath test to detect COVID-19
node.description: InspectIR COVID-19 Breathalyzer test can detect infections using only a breath sample and yield results in less than three minutes.

node.title: Fiji investigates arrival of Russian oligarch's vessel, questions captain
node.description: Fiji police are investigating the arrival of a luxury vessel owned by a Russian oligarch, questioning its captain about how he brought the boat to the Pacific island nation without customs clearance.

node.title: CIA Director William Burns decries Russia's "horrific" crimes in Ukraine
node.description: He called Putin an "apostle of payback" whose appetite for risk has grown as his circle of trusted advisers has shrunk over the years.

node.title: Over half of restaurants that didn't get aid are at risk closing
node.description: More than half of the establishments that didn't receive revitalization grants say they'll close within six months.

node.title: Rent in major U.S. cities has surged 17% from a year ago
node.description: The median monthly rent in March climbed to $1,807 as housing costs rise even faster than inflation.

node.title: Church-goers able to 'reconnect with each other' this Easter, cathedral dean says
node.description: With the lifting of restrictions under the orange traffic light setting, there will be no limit on the number of people who can attend Easter Services at churches across the motu.

node.title: More problems fueling NASA moon rocket
node.description: A third attempt to fuel NASA's SLS moon rocket in a practice countdown was derailed by technical snags.

node.title: Amy's Kitchen faces boycott threat after workers allege mistreatment
node.description: Employees claim unsafe working conditions at one of the organic food maker's plants have led to lost limbs and other injuries.

node.title: Russia says Moskva warship has sunk, after Ukraine said it hit the ship with a missile strike
node.description: The Ukrainian military said its forces had badly damaged the ship​ with a missile strike off Ukraine's battered southern coast.

node.title: Death threats from teens during broad daylight attack on Auckland shop
node.description: A shop owner in an Auckland suburb that has been plagued by burglaries and ram raids had a knife pulled on him by two teenage girls yesterday, who threatened to kill him over $100 worth of shisha…

node.title: Elderly couple killed in New Mexico wildfire
node.description: The McBride Fire had burned over 5,700 acres as of midday Thursday and was 0% contained.

node.title: South African leader visits flood victims as death toll rises to 306

node.title: Arizona man arrested after 183 frozen animals allegedly found in his freezer
node.description: Michael Patrick Turland, 43, allegedly admitted to freezing some of the animals while they were still alive.

node.title: More than 50 children given expired Covid-19 vaccine
node.description: Expired Covid-19 vaccines have been given to 56 Taranaki children but the district health board says they face no harm.

node.title: Political donor Ed Buck sentenced to 30 years for fatal injections
node.description: Buck was sentenced to 30 years in prison for providing fatal doses of drugs, operating a drug den and enticing men to travel for prostitution.

node.title: RNC votes to pull out of Commission on Presidential Debates
node.description: Party members voted unanimously to ban participation in the general election debates during their annual spring meeting in Memphis.

node.title: Woods and Mickelson eye tee off in US Open
node.description: Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson have both reportedly put their names into contention for the US Open Championship.
